meanings.definition: A person who is granted something, especially property or a right.
meanings.sent1: The grantees of the scholarship were thrilled to receive the financial aid.
meanings.sent2: The grantees of the land were responsible for its maintenance and upkeep.
meanings.sent3: The grantees of the treasure map set off on a wild adventure to find the hidden riches.
meanings.sent4: The grantees of the magical powers used them wisely to help others in need.
meanings.sent5: The grantees of the wishes made sure to think carefully before making their desires known.

meanings.definition: Third person singular present of grant.
meanings.sent1: He grantees her request without hesitation.
meanings.sent2: The judge grantees the motion to proceed with the trial.
meanings.sent3: The genie grantees three wishes to the lucky person who frees them from the lamp.
meanings.sent4: The fairy grantees the brave knight the power to defeat the dragon.
meanings.sent5: The king grantees the knight a title for their heroic deeds in battle.
